channel.description: Official blog for PrestaShop development straight from the product and core dev team.

item.title: Set up your Git for contributing
item.description: Any open source project comes with its own set of rules to harmonize everybody’s contributions. Usually the guidelines are described in a CONTRIBUTING.md file inside the project root directory.

item.title: Announcing PrestaShop 1.6.1.1
item.description: We’ve had a lot of great feedback since the release of version 1.6.1.0 of PrestaShop. We are very happy to see that issues seem to be few, non-critical and fixable.

item.title: Hurrah for the 2000th member of our translation project!
item.description: Hurrah for the 2000th member of our translation project!

item.title: PrestaShop Core Weekly - Week 27
item.description: This edition of the Core Weekly report highlights changes in PrestaShop core codebase during the last week, from Monday 29th of June to Sunday 5th of July, 2015.

item.title: Do you speak PrestaShop? – June 2015 edition
item.description: Here is the new report to inform you of what has been going on PrestaShop translation project on Crowdin this June 2015.

item.title: Presenting the Advanced EU Compliance module
item.description: As good news never come alone, let us introduce you to the new module that is included natively in PrestaShop from 1.6.1.0 version: Advanced EU Compliance.

item.title: PrestaShop Core Weekly - Weeks 25 & 26
item.description: This edition of the Core Weekly report highlights changes in PrestaShop core codebase during the last two weeks, from Monday 15th to Sunday 28st of June, 2015.

item.title: PrestaShop 1.6.1.0: RC5 and release date
item.description: You’ve all been very active in testing the previous Release Candidate - thank you very much for your feedback, both on the forums and on the Forge!

item.title: Dropping support for PHP 5.2 and 5.3
item.description: At PrestaShop, we want to make e-commerce possible for everyone. No matter where you are, no matter how much you can (or cannot) spend on your hosting, no matter how big or how small your store is. Because we’ve always made sure your PrestaShop store could run on a cheap shared hosting plan in a far far away land, we had to support PHP all the way back to version 5.2 – a version that has been unsupported since January 2011.
